messages.title: Fighting for Furness
messages.content: I have been so proud to stand up for the area I love as your MP. There is still so much to do, so I am asking you to vote re-elect me on 7 May.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Hospital services at Furness General Hospital
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue the fight to keep vital services at Furness General Hospital.
Maximise potential for local jobs and make sure as many people as possible benefit from Barrow shipyard and GSK in Ulverston.
Lead Furness-wide push to drive up education standards so no children are left behind.
Fight to safeguard and improve our rail links and demand upgrades to the A595 and A590.
Protecting the future of Furness General Hospital.
Push for the rail, road and web links we need.
Securing the shipyard and our economic future.

issues.economy: Labour will finish the successor submarine programme it began when last in government.
issues.education: Lead Furness-wide push to drive up education standards so no children are left behind.
issues.health: Protecting the future of Furness General Hospital.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been so proud to stand up for the area I love as your MP.

politicalExperience.achievements: Has stood up for the local hospital and economy.

endorsements.endorsement: Charity trustee, Ulverston, praises John's work with charity Alice's Escapes.
Naval Architect, BAE Systems, talks about John's effort for the Royal Navy yard and job security.
Head teacher, Victoria Junior School, Barrow, endorses John's understanding of the needs of local families.

leaflet.additionalNotes: John is presented as a candidate who is actively involved in supporting the local community and economy, particularly in terms of education, health services, and transport infrastructure.
